item.title: 8 Best Final Lines In Final Fantasy Games
item.description:
Summary

  • "Am I...All Alone Again? Where Am I?" - An emotional and lonely final line from Final Fantasy 8.
  • "These, These Are Our Terms" - Clive's promise to change the world for the better.
  • "It's Finally Over..." - Noctis's relief and resolution to be with Lunafreya.

Final Fantasy games are known for being packed full of dialogue, which makes sense considering how long and complex many of the stories are, alongside the characters who always embark on their own lengthy personal arcs throughout the narrative. However, while most Final Fantasy games feature incredible endings that tend to stick with players long after the credits roll, the final line can make them all the more emotional and memorable when done right.

This can't just be any old comment though, as a final quote needs to say something about the game's themes, narrative, and characters, whether it be a hopeful reflection on the adventure, or a slightly more pessimistic one. Either way, there have been plenty of iconic final lines seen in the series, but which is considered the most impactful of them all?

Before jumping in, this list will only count the final lines said by characters before the credits officially roll, so post-credit or mid-credit quotes won't be considered.

1 "Am I...All Alone Again? Where Am I?" - Final Fantasy 8

An Eerie Line That Matches The Bizarre Final Sequence Of Final Fantasy 8

Final Fantasy 8 has one of the strangest endings in the entire series, showing Squall trying to find his way through a large open deserted area after Ultimecia's time compression begins to distort reality. Before he winds up here though, Squall lets out a final line which is actually quite emotional given how he was known to be a very lonely protagonist for much of his life, asking himself whether he can really go through that kind of experience once again after being separated from his friends.

Thankfully, this rather troubling line is soon after paired with a visual of Rinoa finding Squall and reuniting with him in the ballroom, showing that he doesn't need to be alone any longer thanks to the many friends he's made along the adventure. While it therefore highlights a core aspect of Squall's character, it also amplifies the bizarreness of 8 's ending in general.

2 "These, These Are Our Terms - Final Fantasy 16

Clive Makes One Final Promise To His Late Brother

For the first half of Final Fantasy 16 , all Clive can think about is seeking revenge on the ones who took his younger brother away from him. However, while he is initially fueled by his anger and rage, Clive eventually comes to learn the importance of moving on and trying to save those that he is still capable of helping. By the end of the game, after managing to have a final few words with his brother, who survived the attack, Clive promises that he will change the world, but this time, on "our" terms.

What he means by this is getting rid of the systems and ideologies that drove the world into chaos to begin with, including Dominants, Bearers, and magic. Considering the relationship between Clive and Joshua is very much at the heart of Final Fantasy 16 's story, it only seems fitting they would also be the focus of the final line, which sees them changing the world for the better.

3 "It's Finally Over..." - Final Fantasy 15

Noctis Can Finally Rest After A Long And Chaotic Journey

Noctis' mission in Final Fantasy 15 is pretty simple: make the journey to his bride-to-be, Lunafreya, so that the arranged marriage can take place to bring peace between warring kingdoms. In classic Final Fantasy fashion though, the journey is packed full of twists and turns that take a massive toll on Noctis, though thanks to his friends always pushing him on, he eventually grows powerful enough to put an end to the evil Ardyn, using up the rest of his life force as a result.

As he crumbles away into the afterlife, Noctis exclaims with his final breath that the adventure is "finally over," allowing him to reunite with Lunafereya as they can be seen sitting on the throne together as king and queen. Hearing this from Noctis puts into perspective just how much hardship the prince had to go through to reach Luna and the many sacrifices he made to get there.

4 "I Beseech Thee, Wondrous Moonlight, Grant Me My Only Wish. Bring My Beloved Dagger To Me" - Final Fantasy 9

A Humorous Surprise From Zidane Ends Of Final Fantasy 9 On A Hopeful Note

Zidane is the fun-loving protagonist of Final Fantasy 9 who is always getting up to all sorts of mischief in his spare time, and despite how much he matures throughout the game, his goofy side shows itself one final time in the last scene. Disguised as a hooded performer, Zidane begins waxing poetic as if he's Shakespeare himself, throwing players off before he eventually throws off his cloak and reveals himself to be the one and only Zidane in the flesh.

No fan can ever forget the first time they saw Zidane surprising Queen Garnet for the final time at the end of the game, but this monologue from the plucky protagonist sure did an excellent job at hiding his identity until he was ready to spill the beans.

5 "Now We Live On, To Greet A New Dawn" - Final Fantasy 13

An Emotional Farewell To The True Heroes Of Final Fantasy 13's Story

Though Final Fantasy 13 often gets treated like the black sheep of the series due to its linearity and straightforward battle system, one aspect that many fans agree was top-notch and truly impactful was the ending. To prevent Cocoon from being destroyed, Vanille and Fang, two Gran Pulse natives who become mainstays in the party, become Ragnarok to protect the planet from falling, therefore fulfilling their Focus.

This specific line, which is said by Vanille as the rest of the party look on in amazement, is an unusually serious quote from the often carefree medic of the group, which shows just how much she's matured throughout the story. It's also just a poetic note to end on, and an emotional goodbye to some of the game's most lovable characters.

6 "It Wasn't My Imagination...I Heard My Bother's Voice Say...'So Long'" - Final Fantasy 4

Cecil Ensures Players Will Be Weeping Their Eyes Out With His Final Quote

Cecil, the main protagonist of Final Fantasy 4 , has a pretty unusual relationship with his brother, Golbez. After Golbez becomes corrupted and attempts to steal the Crystals as part of his master plan to take over the world, Cecil and his newfound party of friends are forced to do battle with his cronies until they finally get the chance to take him on one-on-one at the very end. After Golbez's defeat, the final sequence of the game shows Cecil getting ready for his wedding, but before he says his vows, he decides to reflect on his brother for just a moment while he has a spare minute to himself.

Cecil remarks that he wasn't simply imagining things when he thought he had heard his brother say "so long" as a parting gift to him before the two separated. It's a real gut punch of a quote that will catch a lot of players off guard if they don't have a box of tissues at the ready.

7 "I Miss It. The Steel Sky" - Final Fantasy 7 Remake

An Eerie Glimpse Into The Dangerous Adventure That Awaits Cloud And The Gang

Throughout the Final Fantasy 7 Remake , it gradually becomes clear that Aerith knows a little more than she's letting on as if she's aware of where the party is heading, and the danger they are putting themselves in by embarking on their quest to chase down Sephiroth. This is summed up perfectly in this thought-provoking final line of the game where, after feeling a few drops of rain, Aerith comments that she misses the "steel sky," as if she felt some kind of safety and familiarity being trapped inside the walls of Midgar.

Despite how much the characters complain about Midgar and the way its citizens are treated, this line creates a sense of unease since it gets players to wonder what exactly Aerith is referring to, and how the outside world could possibly be any more dangerous.

8 "The People And The Friends That We Have Lost, Or The Dreams That Have Faded...Never Forget Them" - Final Fantasy 10

Yuna Reminds Players To Reflect On The Journey And The People That Were Lost Along The Way

At the very end of Final Fantasy 10 , after a long and arduous pilgrimage, the world of Spira is saved once again from the oncoming threat of Sin, thanks to the sacrifice made by Tidus. As Yuna stands up to give a grand speech to the people of Spira, she ends her hopeful proclamation by encouraging her friends to never forget the memories and friends that may have been lost over time.

On the one hand, this is a heartfelt way for Yuna to tell her people that they should always keep Sin's victims close to their hearts since maintaining their memories of them allows them to live on spiritually. At the same time, it also feels like Yuna is speaking to herself, ensuring that she will never forget Tidus and the wonderful journey the two embarked on, which created many happy memories that she will never forget.

item.title: Monopoly GO: Today's Event Schedule & Best Strategy (January 22, 2025)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Monopoly GO Events Schedule for January 22, 2025
  • Best Monopoly GO Strategy For January 22, 2025

With Juggle Jam coming to a close, Monopoly GO players are already excited about the next adventure. This time around, Peg-E is hosting another one of her special minigames: The Prize Drop. It’s a limited-time event, so players need to participate actively to maximize their rewards. While luck plays a role, players can strategize by collecting as many tokens as possible to increase their chances of winning bigger and better prizes. This guide covers the best Monopoly GO strategy for January 22, 2025, focusing on all the events scheduled today.

Monopoly GO Events Schedule for January 22, 2025

Monopoly GO has a bunch of exciting events planned for January 22, 2025. Check out the sections below to see what's happening today.

Solo Event

Here’s the solo event going live in Monopoly GO today:

Duration

Icy Spectacle

10 AM EST

Here’s the special minigame you can enjoy in Monopoly GO today:

Duration

10 AM (01/22) - 7:59 AM (01/24) EST

Flash Events

Here are all the flash events happening in Monopoly GO today:

Flash Event

Duration

Time

Builder’s Bash (50%)

All Monopoly GO events listed here are based on recent trends and are subject to change by Scopely at any time.

Best Monopoly GO Strategy For January 22, 2025

There aren’t many flash events planned for today, which makes it a rather slow day in Monopoly GO . If you can, try to catch the early morning Builder’s Bash event and build as many landmarks as you can. Don’t worry about running low on cash — there are a bunch of events, like Rent Frenzy, Free Parking, and Cash Grab, that can help you refill your funds and keep your Monopoly GO journey rolling along.

Wait for the Prize Drop to go live before completing your Quick Wins in Monopoly GO . This way, you can get a handful of Peg-E chips to get a headstart on the minigame. Besides this, you can get 725 Peg-E chips from the top event and 515 chips from the side event launching today.

item.title: Diablo 4: All Boss Loot Tables
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Duriel, King of Maggots
  • Echo of Varshan
  • Grigoire, the Galvanic Saint
  • The Beast in Ice
  • Lord Zir
  • Malphas
  • Echo of Andariel
  • Diablo 4 Infernal Horde Loot Table
  • Mythic Uniques

Loot lies in the heart of Diablo 4 , and Unique items serve as the ultimate chase for players who want to min-max their characters. The hunt for Uniques has gone through some changes since the game's launch, and in this regard, there's no bigger addition to the game than the ability to target-farm those coveted pieces of build-defining gear.

Torment-tier bosses were added to Diablo 4 in Season of Blood, and they offer players a riveting challenge along with a chance to obtain Unique weapons and armor. Loot drops vary per boss, though, so here's a quick cheat sheet on who drops what.

Updated January 22, 2024 by Marc Santos: Diablo 4 Season of Witchcraft introduced eight new Unique items spread across the game's playable classes. However, Season 7 does not have a new boss for players to fight. Instead, they'll have to farm these new items from the existing ladder bosses. Players can farm for Season of Witchcraft's Unique items by fighting Lord Zir, Varshan, and the Beast in Ice — we've updated this guide to include the exact locations of these new items.

All ladder bosses can only be challenged in Torment difficulty.

Duriel, King of Maggots

Class

Item

Barbarian

  • Tuskhelm of Joritz the Mighty

Necromancer

  • Black River
  • Blood Moon Breeches

Rogue

  • Cowl of the Nameless
  • Scoundrel's Leathers

Druid

  • Tempest Roar
  • Dolmen Stone

Sorcerer

  • Flamescar
  • Blue Rose

Spiritborn

  • Sepazontec
  • Rod of Kepeleke

Universal

  • Godslayer Crown
  • Flickerstep
  • Tibault's Will
  • X'Fal's Corroded Signet
  • Soulbrand
  • Banished Lord's Talisman
  • Azurewrath

Duriel becomes a farmable boss once in Torment difficulty after they beat Grigoire and Varshan, who drop the essential Shards of Agony and Mucus-Slick Eggs items needed for the King of Maggots. Get two of each of these, then go to the Gaping Crevasse Level 100 dungeon in southern Kehjistan, southeast of Gea Kul.

Echo of Varshan

Class

Item

Barbarian

  • 100,000 Steps
  • Fields of Crimson
  • Ring of Red Furor
  • Gohr's Devastating Grips

Necromancer

  • Bloodless Scream
  • Deathspeaker's Pendant
  • Ring of the Sacrilegious Soul
  • Deathless Visage

Rogue

  • Eyes in the Dark
  • Skyhunter
  • Condemnation
  • Writhing Band of Trickery

Druid

  • Vasily's Prayer
  • Greatstaff of the Crone
  • Mad Wolf's Glee
  • Airidah's Inexorable Will

Sorcerer

  • Staff of Endless Rage
  • Raiment of the Infinite
  • Esu's Heirloom
  • Tal Rasha's Iridescent Loop

Spiritborn

  • Craze of the Dead God
  • Ring of the Midday Hunt
  • Ring of Writhing Moon
  • Sustained War-Crozier (NEW - S7)

Universal

  • Frostburn
  • Mother's Embrace

Varshan is an excellent source of some of Diablo 4's best Unique items, like the Bloodless Scream and Mad Wolf's Glee. Players can find him hiding in the Malignant Burrow dungeon next to the Tree of Whispers in Hawezar. To summon Varshan, collect Malignant Hearts from Whisper caches, Nightmare Dungeons, elites, and Helltide bosses, and use them at the Putrid Altar inside the dungeon.

Grigoire, the Galvanic Saint

Class

Item

Barbarian

  • Unbroken Chain
  • Battle Trance
  • Rage of Harrogath
  • Twin Strikes

Necromancer

  • Howl from Below
  • Greaves of the Empty Tomb
  • Path of Trag'Oul
  • Ebonpiercer

Rogue

  • Word of Hakan
  • Shroud of Khanduras
  • Grasp of Shadow
  • Saboteur's Signet

Druid

  • Waxing Gibbous
  • Hunter's Zenith
  • Insatiable Fury
  • Earthbreaker

Sorcerer

  • Iceheart Brais
  • Axial Conduit
  • Staff of Lam Esen
  • Flameweaver

Spiritborn

  • Peacemonger's Signet
  • Loyalty's Mantle
  • Ring of the Midnight Sun
  • Protection of the Prime

Universal

  • Penitent Greaves
  • The Butcher's Cleaver

Grigoire can be found in the Hall of the Penitent in the Dry Steppes , directly south of Ked Bardu. He can be summoned by offering 12 Living Steel , a type of material that can be obtained from Tortured Offerings in Helltides, elite enemies, World Bosses, Whisper caches, Kurast Undercity, and the vendor in The Den.

The Beast in Ice

Class

Item

Barbarian

  • Hellhammer
  • Ancients' Oath
  • Ring of the Ravenous
  • Mantle of Mountain's Fury (NEW - S7)

Necromancer

  • The Unmaker
  • Ring of Mendeln
  • Mutilator Plate
  • Indira's Memory (NEW - S7)

Rogue

  • Windforce
  • Eaglehorn
  • Beastfall Boots

Druid

  • Stone of Vehemen
  • Storm's Companion
  • Unsung Ascetic's Wraps

Sorcerer

  • Gloves of the Illuminator
  • The Oculus
  • Starfall Coronet
  • Strike of Stormhorn (NEW - S7)

Spiritborn

  • Wound Drinker
  • Harmony of Ebewaka
  • Scorn of the Earth

Universal

  • Fists of Fate
  • Tassets of the Dawning Sky
  • Paingorger's Gauntlets

The Beast in Ice is inside the Glacial Fissure dungeon south of Kyovashad in the Fractured Peaks. To fight the boss, players must have a Glacial Fissure Nightmare Sigil, which is crafted using 250 Sigil Powder and 12 Distilled Fear , a resource that can drop from any source that drops other ladder boss materials (Helltide chests, Nightmare Dungeons, Whisper caches, etc).

Lord Zir

Lord Zir is in the Darkened Way , a dungeon in the northern tip of the Gale Valley region in the Fractured Peaks . It can be found northeast of Yelesna. To summon Zir, players must collect 12 vials of Exquisite Blood .

Class

Item

Barbarian

  • Overkill
  • Ramaladni's Magnum Opus
  • Ugly Bastard Helm
  • Arreat's Bearing

Necromancer

  • Lidless Wall
  • Blood Artisan's Cuirass
  • Cruor's Embrace
  • Kessime's Legacy (NEW - S7)

Rogue

  • Asheara's Khanjar
  • Pitfighter's Gull
  • Scoundrel's Kiss
  • Assassin's Stride (NEW - S7)

Druid

  • Mjolnic Ryng
  • Fleshrender
  • Wildheart Hunger
  • Malefic Crescent (NEW - S7)

Sorcerer

  • Sidhe Bindings
  • Esadora's Overflowing Cameo
  • Fractured Winterglass
  • Okun's Catalyst (NEW - S7)

Spiritborn

  • Wushe Nak Pa
  • Band of First Breath
  • Jacinth Shell

Universal

  • Temerity
  • Razorplate
  • Yen's Blessing

Malphas

As of Season of the Construct, Malphas does not have his own unique loot table. Instead, he has a chance to drop the following Unique Tuning Stones, which can be equipped on your Seneschal companion:

  • Evernight - Using the supported Skill grants +4 to all your other Skills for 2.0 seconds.
  • Genesis - Increases the effectiveness of the supported Skill by 150%.

To summon and fight the Echo of Malphas in Season 3, players must bring 7 Igneous Cores, 3-4 Pearls of Warding, and 250 Shattered Stones to the Vault of the Loom in Gatehall. Enter the dungeon, spend your Pearls at the Zoltun Kulle statue, then offer the remaining materials to proceed.

Malphas was a boss exclusive to Season 3, and as of Season 6, players can no longer fight him.

Echo of Andariel

Class

Item

Barbarian

  • Tuskhelm of Joritz the Mighty

Necromancer

  • Black River
  • Blood Moon Breeches

Rogue

  • Cowl of the Nameless
  • Scoundrel's Leathers

Druid

  • Tempest Roar
  • Dolmen Stone

Sorcerer

  • Flamescar
  • Blue Rose

Spiritborn

  • Sepazontec
  • Rod of Kepeleke

Universal

  • Godslayer Crown
  • Flickerstep
  • Tibault's Will
  • X'Fal's Corroded Signet
  • Soulbrand
  • Banished Lord's Talisman
  • Azurewrath

Diablo 4 Season 4 introduced Andariel as one of the bosses players can fight in Torment difficulty. In order to reach her, you'll need to first get Sandscorched Shackles from Lord Zir and Pincushioned Dolls from The Beast In Ice . Her loot table is exactly the same as Duriel's.

Andariel basically acts as an alternative to Duriel. Her existence also boosts the value of Lord Zir and the Beast In Ice since they drop the materials needed to summon her. Players who find themselves fighting these two bosses frequently will eventually be able to challenge Andariel, giving them more chances to obtain powerful gear.

Diablo 4 Infernal Horde Loot Table

Infernal Horde was introduced in Diablo 4 Season 5 as a wave-based survival mode for endgame characters. The goal here is to complete all waves and beat the Fell Council without using up all available revives. Collect Burning Aether to open chests and earn plenty of loot. Among the items you can get here are the following:

Class

Item

Barbarian

  • The Third Blade
  • Executioner's Aspect
  • Aspect of Anger Management
  • Aspect of the Fortress

Necromancer

  • The Mortacrux
  • Aspect of the Cursed Aura
  • Aspect of the Great Feast
  • Shademist Aspect

Rogue

  • The Umbracrux
  • Aspect of True Sight
  • Coldclip Aspect
  • Clandestine Aspect

Druid

  • The Basilisk
  • Spirit Bond Aspect
  • Rejuvenating Aspect
  • Moonrage Aspect

Sorcerer

  • Vox Omnium
  • Winter Touch Aspect
  • Firestarter Aspect
  • Jolting Aspect

Universal

  • Locran's Talisman
  • Shard of Verathiel
  • Endurant Faith
  • Crown of Lucion
  • Rakanoth's Wake
  • Wildbolt Aspect
  • Aspect of Inevitable Fate
  • Sticker-thought Aspect
  • Aspect of Sly Steps
  • Aspect of Creeping Death
  • Aspect of the Dark Dance
  • Aspect of the Prudent Heart

These items and Aspects are not exclusive to the Infernal Horde, but they have a higher chance of dropping in this activity.

Mythic Uniques

Previously known as Uber Uniques, these items are as powerful as they are rare. Mythic Uniques have the lowest drop rates out of any item in the game, but they also come with the best stats and effects in the game. These items can drop from any boss .

Item

Class

The Grandfather

  • Barbarian
  • Necromancer

Ahavarion, Spear of Lycander

  • Sorcerer
  • Druid

Nesekem, the Herald

  • Spiritborn

Doombringer

  • All

Shroud of False Death

  • All

Ring of Starless Skies

  • All

Shattered Vow

  • All

Tyrael's Might

  • All

Harlequin Crest

  • All

Andariel's Visage

  • All

Melted Heart of Selig

  • All

item.title: 9 Best Final Fantasy Games Set In Traditional Fantasy Worlds, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Final Fantasy games feature diverse settings, from classic medieval worlds to unique blends of fantasy and technology with iconic environments like Ivalice and Valisthea.
  • Final Fantasy 16 introduces a dark fantasy world of Valisthea, blending action JRPG combat with a well-built story.
  • Final Fantasy 9 returns to the franchise's medieval fantasy roots, offering a rich setting with captivating characters.

Final Fantasy games are recognized as one of the most iconic franchises among JRPGs, showcasing an impressive diversity of settings. From renowned locations like Ivalice, featured in multiple titles, to unique worlds crafted for specific narratives, these environments play a crucial role in story development, providing players with a unique immersion.

In addition to settings focused on Steampunk, such as in Final Fantasy 7 , the franchise also stands out for offering some of the best Final Fantasy games set in classic fantasy worlds . These classic universes are perfect for fans of medieval-inspired environments, where they face dangerous challenges and engage in epic stories filled with high stakes to save the world.

Few Final Fantasy games strictly follow traditional fantasy settings, often blending in technology, but these titles excel at exploring this unique blend.

9 Final Fantasy 14

A Medieval Fantasy Blends With Technology In This MMORPG

  • World: Hydaelyn

A common element in Final Fantasy games is that they rarely strictly adhere to the traditional medieval fantasy setting. Even though many titles feature typical genre settings, there are notable deviations, such as the inclusion of technological elements. In Final Fantasy 14 , for example, the world displays everything expected of a fantastical universe but also incorporates characteristics that deviate from this rule.

One of the main reasons for this is the peculiarity of the Garleans, a race unable to manipulate magic like the others. To compensate, they resort to advanced technology, creating a contrast with the setting the game possesses. Therefore, during the exploration through the MMO, it's not uncommon to encounter robots, adding a slight touch of science fiction to this predominantly fantasy-themed entry in the Final Fantasy series.

8 Final Fantasy Tactics Advance

A More Colorful View Of Ivalice

  • World: Ivalice

Although also set in a kingdom called Ivalice, the setting of Final Fantasy Tactics Advance is, in fact, a medieval fantasy world created from Mewt Randell's wishes. Thus, the scenario becomes a magical and more colorful kingdom than depicted in other games set in this environment, also adopting a more childlike tone, reflecting his imagination.

Despite this tonal difference, the game maintains the essence that makes it a medieval fantasy JRPG, inhabited by various races that are also common in the franchise. Even though the story does not address common themes of Ivalice, such as disputes and political intrigues, the game still delivers a good experience for players and serves as a good entry point to the Final Fantasy ’s series.

7 Final Fantasy 3

Game Responsible For The Job System In The Series

  • World: World of Light

The classic setting of Final Fantasy 3, where the crystals of light choose four young individuals to restore the natural balance of the world, is similar to the previous two games, but it introduced players to a more enjoyable adventure, with satisfying gameplay innovations. Additionally, the classic setting, with kingdoms, dungeons, and mythological creatures, captured the essence of the series.

However, the biggest milestone of Final Fantasy 3 is not the setting but the introduction of a new job system, more complex than that of the first game, which became one of the main innovations of the series. This allowed players to customize character abilities by choosing different classes throughout the story, making the gameplay innovative.

6 Final Fantasy 16

Action JRPG With Some Dark Fantasy Elements

  • World: Valisthea

Returning again to the medieval fantasy setting, Final Fantasy 16 brought a new perspective to the franchise, blending action JRPG combat with a dark and well-built world. The game takes place in Valisthea, a world divided by kingdoms fighting for control of the crystals. Despite having some common series tropes, the game's atmosphere marked a significant advancement in the series.

The story centers on Clive Rosfield's path, delivering a narrative that follows his progress through different stages of his life, from childhood to adulthood, providing a perfect balance between the character's different tones. Additionally, the frenetic gameplay, despite deviating from the franchise's traditional elements, blends very well with the entire narrative and setting.

5 Final Fantasy 1

The Beginning Of The Series Is A Classic Medieval Fantasy

  • World: World A

The first Final Fantasy games were deeply inspired by the Middle Ages, with Final Fantasy 1 establishing this tradition. In this title, set in the world known as World A, players take on the role of the Warriors of Light on a quest that begins with rescuing Princess Sarah from Garland, evolving to restoring the crystals' light.

Although its narrative is relatively simple, for its time, the game was considered one of the best fantasy JRPGs. It transported players to memorable medieval settings, filled with classic genre elements like mythological creatures and characteristic environments. The playable classes also offered abilities inspired by classic medieval fantasy archetypes, consolidating the foundation for the franchise's success.

4 Final Fantasy 5

Crystals, Magic, And All The Good Things In Classic Final Fantasy Game

  • World: Planet R

Following the franchise's classic tropes, Final Fantasy 5 presents a story centered on elemental crystals and the natural balance they provide to the world. However, as expected in a medieval fantasy JRPG, the crystals are deteriorating. Bartz, a determined adventurer, joins other characters to prevent Exdeath, an evil sorcerer imprisoned for a thousand years, from destroying the world.

The highlight of Final Fantasy 5 is its upgraded job system, which allows players to customize characters with different classes. This mechanic offers the freedom to create strategic compositions to overcome challenges. Experimenting with different builds while exploring the game's unknown territories makes the adventure even more dynamic as the heroes seek to save the crystals from Exdeath's threat.

3 Final Fantasy 4

Epic Journey Featuring One Of The Series' Best Protagonists

  • World: Blue Planet

Final Fantasy 4 is one of the franchise's most emblematic titles, featuring a rich medieval fantasy setting blended with magical technology that delights genre fans. The game combines castles, knights, and spells in a plot that explores redemption and sacrifice, establishing itself as one of the best Final Fantasy games with classic fantasy settings.

The story follows Cecil Harvey, a dark knight who, after questioning his kingdom's orders, embarks on a path to redeem himself. Along the way, Cecil faces betrayals, develops deep relationships, and uncovers secrets that shape his destiny. This emotional narrative, combined with an iconic soundtrack and memorable characters, makes Final Fantasy IV an eternal landmark in the series.

2 Final Fantasy 9

A Return To Medieval Fantasy In The Franchise

  • World: Gaia

Released as a tribute to the series' origins, Final Fantasy 9 is widely recognized as one of the best Final Fantasy games. With a setting that evokes rich medieval fantasy, the game marked a return to the franchise's roots after titles that explore Steampunk environments, such as Final Fantasy 7 and Final Fantasy 8 .

The story follows Zidane and his epic adventure in a world filled with castles, magical kingdoms, and mythological creatures. This classic setting, combined with captivating characters and a deeply emotional narrative, solidifies the ninth mainline game of the franchise as one of the brightest examples of Final Fantasy medieval settings, enchanting both old and new fans with its nostalgic and well-executed charm.

1 Final Fantasy Tactics

One Of The Best Settings Ever Created In The Franchise

  • World: Ivalice

The world of Ivalice is one of the most traditional in the series, bringing the main elements of medieval fantasy to the franchise, with Final Fantasy Tactics being the title that best explores this setting's potential. In this strategy JRPG spin-off, players follow the events of the War of The Lions from Ramza Beoulve's perspective.

The narrative is extremely well-crafted, full of interesting and well-developed characters, such as the protagonist and Delita Heyral, who starts as a companion but evolves into a complex anti-hero. This combination of engaging story and solid mechanics, focused on character customization, makes this title also one of the best Final Fantasy games ever created.

item.title: All Active Zenless Zone Zero Redeem Codes (January 2025)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • ZZZ Codes - Zenless Zone Zero Redeem Codes (January 2025)
  • Expired ZZZ Codes - Zenless Zone Zero Redeem Codes
  • How To Redeem Zenless Zone Zero Codes

Zenless Zone Zero , usually abbreviated as ZZZ , is another game by Genshin Impact developer, HoYoverse. However, unlike Honkai: Star Rail and Genshin Impact , ZZZ is set in a different universe outside the Honkaiverse. ZZZ storyline takes place in New Eridu, a futuristic metropolis where people live after surviving the apocalypse called the Hollows. This disaster generates anomalies in the dimensions and causes monsters called Ethereal to appear, creating an immense number of casualties within humanity.

In Zenless Zone Zero , players are renowned Proxy under the code name Phaethon . However, due to unexpected circumstances, the protagonist must scrap all their hard work and rebuild their reputation under a new alias. A Proxy is someone who guides Hollow Raiders inside the Hollow. Phaethon does their job by syncing with a Bangboo and entering the Hollow, leading the Hollow Raiders from the safety of their headquarters.

Bangboo is an AI device originally made to help people evacuate from the Hollow apocalypse. However, after the residents established stability, Bangboo is now used for more diverse roles to help in daily life. In ZZZ , players can get Bangboo by "pulling" them from a banner, but unlike with characters, this act will not cost precious Polychromes. This means the resource can be used for better purposes, such as getting new Agents or refilling Battery (energy). Other than through daily missions and quests, players can also earn goodies from redeem codes. Therefore, this article will serve as a place where Proxies can check for new ZZZ codes whenever they become available.

ZZZ Codes - Zenless Zone Zero Redeem Codes (January 2025)

Here are all the ZZZ codes players can exchange for various rewards:

ZZZ Codes

Rewards

ZZZ15MINA

  • Polychrome ×60
  • Dennies x6,666

HSAHLWFEFE

  • Polychrome ×60
  • Dennies x6,666

ZENLESSGIFT

  • Polychrome ×50
  • Official Investigator Log ×2
  • W-Engine Power Supply ×3
  • Bangboo Algorithm Module x1

How To Redeem Zenless Zone Zero Codes

To redeem ZZZ codes, players can follow these steps:

  • Open the in-game menu in the top-left corner.
  • Press More.
  • Choose Redemption Code.
  • Enter the ZZZ code.
  • Press Redeem.
  • Check your Inbox to claim the reward.

Alternatively, you can visit Zenless Zone Zero redemption code website, log in to your account, choose a server, input the code, and then press redeem.
